|rad1correv = 13 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "2976286801" or something similar is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v.24 rc7 micro - build 9355 (29.03.08) initial flash: use [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP flash|Tftp flash]] Someone who has this router should write a proper wiki entry on how to upgrade, but until that is done, here is a link to some basic information http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=475282

'''dd-wrt Firmware Replacement on Netgear WG602v3 Wireless Access Point'''
[[dd-wrt:User:Augur|Augur]] 11:34, 30 August 2010 (CEST)
====Read This First==== READ the [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=51486 Peacock Thread] first. use the wiki and forums to do research before even contemplating installing dd-wrt
check the WG602v3 works before flashing
check your WG602v3 matches the details in the [[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Supported_Devices#Netgear Supported Devices page]]
====Firmware==== the WG602v3 only has 2mb flash memory so can only support the micro builds
BrainSlayer builds (13525) dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin
ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/older/12-28-09-r13525/broadcom/
[[ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/older/12-28-09-r13525/broadcom/dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin]]
using [[http://www.dd-wrt.com/dd-wrtv2/downloads/others/tornado/Windows-TFTP/tftp2.exe tftp2.exe]]
====Preparing The WG602v3==== #connect the WG602v3 to a computer using a network cable #set static ip of computer to 192.168.0.220/24 #*there should be no means of access to any other router or dhcp server or the WG602v3 will not set its default ip address. #perform a [[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Hard_reset_or_30/30/30 30-30-30 Hard Reset]] #in browser go to http://192.168.0.227 L:admin P:password and check it is the default netgear setup
====Installing dd-wrt==== #on the computer disable firewall and antivirus
#run tftp2.exe #*configure as follows #*Server to 192.168.0.227 #*password leave blank #*pick the firmware #*set rety to 50 #open a command prompt and type in ping 192.168.0.227 -t #unplug power lead from router #replug power lead into router #the instant you get a ping response from the router click Upgrade #*if it doesn't work try unplugging again (timing matters) #*stop pinging the router (ctrl-c)
*(very important) wait 5-7 minutes after you get the success message before doing anything. recomend you walk away and get a drink
====After Install. Initial Preparation Before Use==== #reconfigure the static ip of the computer to 192.168.1.220/24 #in browser go to http://192.168.1.1 #*if you get the dd-wrt web gui password change page perform a power cycle on the router #when the web gui comes up again perform a 30-30-30 hard reset #wait for gui to come up again #*change default username and password #*close browser #open browser and load the gui again. you should now have the status screen #*login and configure #remember to re-enable firewall, antivirus, and dhcp on the computer [[Category:English Documentation]]
